page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: The Danton family have farmed in the Donemana district for over one hundred and sixty years they originally came from France.Mr Danton has over four hundred and forty acres of land.There are four men employed on Mr Dantons farm.His stock of dairy cattle is one hundred and sixty cows. The breed of dairy cattle are Fridsian, (kept on his farm).One hundred and twenty beef cattle are reared.Thirty acres of the land are devoted to arable farming.The only crop grown on his land is barly.The major changes in farming over the past thirty years have been a move from mixed farming to specialised dairy and beef production. Farming in future will become less intensive due to over productions of most food stuffs in the E.E.C.
